channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Wet leaves and litter, 30th October
item.description:
Please can we get street cleaning team out to clear the wet leaves and litter both sides of Sutherland Road from houses 2 to 80 Sutherland and from 1 Sutherland Road to 79 Sutherland road. The pavement is slippery and dangerous to walk.on. particularly bad for elderly accident waiting to happen. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): South Road, Edmonton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sign partly detached - pedestrian hazard, 30th October
item.description:
A sign for parking is partly detached from its place and is hanging out in the way of pedestrians - it is a hazard particularly for anyone distracted whole walking along. Would be grateful to see this fixed: seems to have only happened in the past few days. Thank you!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Warwick Street, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vegetation halving pavement, 30th October
item.description:
Overhanging vegetation is blocking half the pavement on a narrow section of the pavement. People are having tonwait for other people to pass it before they can continue walking. Small children and people on mobility scooters are either having to move close to the kerb of a busy fast road or get a face full of leaves/twigs etc. Previously reported and updated as "fixed" yesterday. Nothing in fact has been done.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several road water drains blocked., 29th October
item.description:
Several road draids blocked. In particular on the corner of Colyers lane into the square adjascent to No 29 Colyers Lane. The particular problem (here) is that ALL the rainwater from the west of the southern side of Colyers lane drains into the square ( which is 750mm lower Colyers lane 'proper') giving rise to substantial pooling by 39/41 Colyers Lane. The potential for surface water flooding of surrounding properties. This issue is fairly long term-- possibly a couple of years and worsening.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Colyers Lane, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Coleman road corner with Rainbow road, overflowing bins by the pub, 29th October
item.description:
These bins are always completely full and overflowing. If they belong to the flats above the pub, they should be in the building unless it’s collection day, otherwise they should be removed This is a serious hazard by a school, attracting vermin and outing children in danger with broken glass and disease
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Coleman Road, Camberwell, London

item.description:

item.title: Metal skirting around both traffic islands is hanging off, 29th October
item.description:
Metal skirting on both traffic islands is hanging off, its jagged, sharp, EXTREMELY dangerous. It has already caused one person to be hospitalised in the past 6 weeks and has still not been repaired. It is used by parents and small children daily. Someone else is going to get hurt from it soon!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beckenham Lane, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Corner of Willesden Lane and Streatley Road, opposite Bliss Chemist, 29th October
item.description:
Seems like someone's household has been dumped here, including unwashed pots, other domestic utensils, smashed glasses, food, books. I only saw it all when I went out yonight, around 6.30pm.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Willesden Lane, Kilburn, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Possible Illegal migrants living in that house, and landord hasn't registered house with the council, 29th October
item.description:
It is possible that some illegal migrants are living in this house. Moreover, the landord has not registered the house with the council. People throw bins at the front of the house in night when no one is around and walkaway. Around 20-23 people are living

item.title: Telephone exchange door not locking, 29th October
item.description:
The metal doors on the telephone/internet exchange outside 2 Cricketfield Rd is unlocked and sits open all the time. I am concerned that it will be vandalised and/or connections damaged that will effect multiple properties on the Road.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cricketfield Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Station Rise SE27 9BW outside number 12 rubbish bin, 29th October
item.description:
Station Rise SE27 9BW outside number 12 (Xquisite restaurant) is a Lambeth black plastic combined litter / recycle litter bin which is graffiti tagged. Please forward fixmystreet.com link to your contractor re attached picture.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8A, Station Rise, Tulse Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish left outside and on top of bins, 29th October
item.description:
2 Cricketfield has multiple flats and there is constantly rubbish left on the pavement, next to the bins. It is getting worse and worse. It’s a health risk and trip hazard every day, I move the bins out of the way regularly.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cricketfield Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
